propDescriptions.children: Used to render icon or text elements inside the AspectRatio if src is not set. This can be an element, or just a string.
propDescriptions.color: The color of the component. It supports those theme colors that make sense for this component. To learn how to add your own colors, check out Themed components—Extend colors.
propDescriptions.component: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
propDescriptions.maxHeight: The maximum calculated height of the element (not the CSS height).
propDescriptions.minHeight: The minimum calculated height of the element (not the CSS height).
propDescriptions.objectFit: The CSS object-fit value of the first-child.
propDescriptions.ratio: The aspect-ratio of the element. The current implementation uses padding instead of the CSS aspect-ratio due to browser support. https://caniuse.com/?search=aspect-ratio
propDescriptions.slotProps: The props used for each slot inside.
propDescriptions.slots: The components used for each slot inside. See Slots API below for more details.
propDescriptions.sx: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles. See the `sx` page for more details.
propDescriptions.variant: The global variant to use. To learn how to add your own variants, check out Themed components—Extend variants.

root.description: Class name applied to the root element.

slotDescriptions.root: The component that renders the root.
slotDescriptions.content: The component that renders the content.
